alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Caldwell; Clay; Clinton; Platte; Ray (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:59AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Buchanan, southern Daviess, Clinton, northern Clay, northwestern Ray, Caldwell, northeastern Platte, DeKalb and northwestern Livingston Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 1258 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Maysville to near Plattsburg to near Tracy. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Excelsior Springs, Cameron, Smithville, Kearney, Lawson, Plattsburg, Lathrop, Hamilton, Gallatin, Gower, Maysville, Braymer, Stewartsville, Agency, Trimble, Polo, Edgerton, Dearborn, Holt and Osborn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 22 and 71. Interstate 29 between mile markers 29 and 38. Interstate 435 near mile marker 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for north central, northwestern and west central Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Buchanan; Caldwell; Clay; Clinton; Platte; Ray
